title: Topic 001 Question 157
body: A company stores data in an Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL DB cluster. The company must store all the data for 5 years and must delete all the data after 5 years. The company also must indefinitely keep audit logs of actions that are performed within the database. Currently, the company has automated backups configured for Aurora.
Which combination of steps should a solutions architect take to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)
options: Take a manual snapshot of the DB cluster.
Create a lifecycle policy for the automated backups.
Configure automated backup retention for 5 years.
Configure an Amazon CloudWatch Logs export for the DB cluster.
Use AWS Backup to take the backups and to keep the backups for 5 years.
